mechanics.condition: Creature is within 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line originating from caster
mechanics.outcome: Creature must make a Constitution saving throw

mechanics.condition: Creature within line fails its save
mechanics.outcome: Creature takes 6d8 radiant damage and is blinded until caster's next turn

mechanics.condition: Creature within line succeeds on its save
mechanics.outcome: Creature takes half 6d8 radiant damage and is not blinded

mechanics.condition: Target creature is Undead OR target creature is an Ooze
mechanics.outcome: Target makes the save with disadvantage
Caster can create a new 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line, applying the initial effects
A mote of brilliant radiance shines in caster's hand
Mote sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet
The light produced by the mote is considered sunlight

description_text: A beam of brilliant light flashes out from your hand in a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line. Each creature in the line must make a constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d8 radiant damage and is blinded until your next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't blinded by this spell. Undead and oozes have disadvantage on this saving throw. You can create a new line of radiance as your action on any turn until the spell ends. For the duration, a mote of brilliant radiance shines in your hand. It sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. This light is sunlight.
